comments: Number of walks of length n between any two distinct nodes of the complete graph K_8. Example: a(2)=6 because the walks of length 2 between the nodes A and B of the complete graph ABCDEFGH are: ACB, ADB, AEB, AFB, AGB and AHB. - _Emeric Deutsch_, Apr 01 2004General form: k=7^n-k. Also: A001045, A078008, A097073, A115341, A015518, A054878, A015521, A109499, A015531, A109500, A109501. - _Vladimir Joseph Stephan Orlovsky_, Dec 11 2008The ratio a(n+1)/a(n) converges to 7 as n approaches infinity. - _Felix P. Muga II_, Mar 09 2014
references: F. P. Muga II, Extending the Golden Ratio and the Binet-de Moivre Formula, March 2014; Preprint on ResearchGate.

Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (6, 7).
formula: a(n) = 6*a(n-1) + 7*a(n-2).G.f.: x/(1-6*x-7*x^2). a(n) = 7^(n-1)-a(n-1). - _Emeric Deutsch_, Apr 01 2004a(n) = (7^n-(-1)^n)/8. - _Rolf Pleisch_, Jul 06 2009a(n) = round(7^n/8). - _Mircea Merca_, Dec 28 2010
mathematica: k=0;lst={k};Do[k=7^n-k;AppendTo[lst, k], {n, 0, 5!}];lst (* _Vladimir Joseph Stephan Orlovsky_, Dec 11 2008 *)
